intro: Chrysoma fasciculata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shrubland and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and arranged in a fascicle, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are yellow with white rays, blooming in spring and summer.
